sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1:
Let A = {1, 3, 5, 7} and B = {2, 4, 5, 6}. Find:

(a) A symmetric difference B
(b) B symmetric difference A
(c) A intersection (A symmetric difference B)
(d) (A intersection B) symmetric difference B. 

Show that the answer to parts (a) and (b) are not the same, which proves that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
